scheme.name: Global Responsible Sourcing Due Diligence Standard For Mineral Supply Chains - All Minerals
scheme.description: A comprehensive standard for responsible mineral supply chain due diligence based on OECD Due Diligence Guidance, covering management systems, risk assessment, and responsible sourcing practices for all minerals except tin, tantalum, tungsten, gold, cobalt, and mica.

conformityCriterion.name: Step 1 - Establish Strong Company Management Systems
conformityCriterion.description: Companies must adopt and publish a supply chain policy, structure internal management to support due diligence, establish controls and transparency systems, strengthen supplier engagement, and establish grievance mechanisms.

subCriterion.name: Step 1A - Adopt and Commit to Supply Chain Policy
subCriterion.description: Company must publish a policy demonstrating commitment to performing OECD-conforming supply chain due diligence on risks described in Annex II.

subCriterion.name: Written Supply Chain Policy
subCriterion.description: Adopt a written supply chain policy with an effective date.

subCriterion.name: Policy Standards Inclusion
subCriterion.description: Include in the policy the standards against which the company will make assessments of itself and its suppliers' activities.

subCriterion.name: Annex II Consistency
subCriterion.description: Ensure the policy and standards are consistent with those in the Annex II model supply chain policy or equivalent, including timescales for disengagement or progressive improvement through mitigation.

subCriterion.name: Management Process Description
subCriterion.description: Include in the policy a clear and coherent description of the management process for identifying and managing risks.

subCriterion.name: Due Diligence Commitment
subCriterion.description: Include in the policy a commitment to the due diligence steps relevant to its supply chain and operations.

subCriterion.name: Covered Minerals Scope
subCriterion.description: Ensure the policy covers all covered minerals relevant to company activities.

subCriterion.name: Policy Review Process
subCriterion.description: Have and implement a process for periodically reviewing the policy and updating as necessary.

subCriterion.name: Policy Communication
subCriterion.description: Ensure that policy is publicly available and communicated to suppliers.

subCriterion.name: Step 1B - Structure Internal Management
subCriterion.description: Company must have a system in place which assigns responsibility for each relevant aspect of the company's due diligence management process to identified and accountable staff.

subCriterion.name: Responsibility Assignment
subCriterion.description: Assign responsibility for each part of the due diligence management process to appropriate staff.

subCriterion.name: Senior Level Authority
subCriterion.description: Provide authority to staff at a senior level to oversee due diligence.

subCriterion.name: Training and Competence
subCriterion.description: Ensure responsible employees have sufficient knowledge and experience of due diligence through training, including as part of new hire and refresher, on the due diligence management system to relevant personnel.

subCriterion.name: Resource Allocation
subCriterion.description: Allocate adequate resources and staff for due diligence operation and monitoring.

subCriterion.name: Communication Processes
subCriterion.description: Implement communication processes to ensure that critical information – including the company supply chain policy, management processes and information on risks – reaches relevant employees and suppliers.

subCriterion.name: Risk Reporting
subCriterion.description: Report findings on actual and/or potential risks identified in the supply chain to the appointed senior manager.

subCriterion.name: Senior Management Accountability
subCriterion.description: Put in place accountability for senior management expected to oversee due diligence.

subCriterion.name: Decision Integration Records
subCriterion.description: Maintain records on how senior management has incorporated risks and assessments into company decisions.

subCriterion.name: Step 1C - Establish System of Controls and Transparency
subCriterion.description: Company must have in place a chain of custody or traceability system to enable red flag review of covered minerals and suppliers.

subCriterion.name: Mineral Sourcing Information Requirements
subCriterion.description: Collect and retain available information regarding covered minerals, their origin, transport and transit to determine if the known or suspected origin is a CAHRA.

subCriterion.name: Mineral Form and Type
subCriterion.description: Collect form, type and physical description of mineral type, including for by-products.

subCriterion.name: Mineral Origin
subCriterion.description: Collect the stated mineral origin (location of extraction, country or regional mining area within a country).

subCriterion.name: Mining Operations Type
subCriterion.description: Collect the type of operations (Artisanal and Small-Scale Mining - ASM and/or Large-Scale Mining - LSM) of the mined mineral used.

subCriterion.name: LSM Source Assessment
subCriterion.description: Determine if LSM purchase covered materials from other sources, including ASM and whether this may trigger a red flag.

subCriterion.name: Extraction Quantities and Dates
subCriterion.description: Collect quantities and dates of extraction, if available, expressed in volume or weight.

subCriterion.name: Transit Countries
subCriterion.description: Collect countries through which minerals have transited (in sealed shipping containers).

subCriterion.name: Transport Countries
subCriterion.description: Collect countries through which minerals have been transported (not in sealed shipping containers), or in which they have been reprocessed, repacked or handled.

subCriterion.name: Supplier Information Requirements
subCriterion.description: Collect and retain available information regarding immediate suppliers and known upstream actors to determine if supplier trading activities are associated with CAHRAs.

subCriterion.name: Supplier Identity
subCriterion.description: Collect name, addresses and type of business of immediate suppliers.

subCriterion.name: Shareholder Interests
subCriterion.description: Collect aggregated lists of countries in which the supplier has shareholder or company interests.

subCriterion.name: Supplier Sourcing Countries
subCriterion.description: Collect aggregated lists of countries of origin, transport and transit of minerals from which suppliers have sourced over the last 12 months.

subCriterion.name: CAHRA Declaration
subCriterion.description: Collect declaration of the countries or areas determined by the supplier to be a CAHRA.

subCriterion.name: Beneficial Ownership
subCriterion.description: Collect declaration of individuals and entities that hold direct or indirect beneficial ownership stakes in the supplier and review against relevant sanctions lists.

subCriterion.name: Know Your Counterparty (KYC) Process
subCriterion.description: Implement a KYC process to determine identity, type of business relationship and legality of business operations for each supplying counterparty.

subCriterion.name: Counterparty Identity
subCriterion.description: Establish the identity of the supplying counterparty.

subCriterion.name: Ownership Structure
subCriterion.description: Identify ownership of supplying counterparty and corporate structure.

subCriterion.name: Sanctions Verification
subCriterion.description: Verify supplying counterparty and their owners against relevant government sanction lists.

subCriterion.name: KYC Timing
subCriterion.description: Conduct KYC before entering into business relationship and throughout the business relationship.

subCriterion.name: Mass Balance Calculation
subCriterion.description: Calculate a mass balance to substantiate the total material processed, taking into account receipts, inventory, losses, and sales quantities.

subCriterion.name: Inventory Reconciliation
subCriterion.description: The closing inventory (declared) and the closing inventory (calculated) must be within the allowed maximum margin of error of 10%.

subCriterion.name: Discrepancy Investigation
subCriterion.description: Any discrepancies observed during internal material control processes and/or mass balance calculation are investigated and findings recorded.

subCriterion.name: Step 1D - Strengthen Company Engagement with Suppliers
subCriterion.description: Company must aim to establish positive long-term relationships with immediate suppliers to increase leverage over due diligence performance.

subCriterion.name: Long-term Relationships
subCriterion.description: Establish, where practicable, long-term relationships with immediate suppliers.

subCriterion.name: Supplier Policy Commitment
subCriterion.description: Confirm that immediate suppliers commit to a supply chain policy consistent with Annex II and the OECD Guidance.

subCriterion.name: Expectations Communication
subCriterion.description: Communicate to immediate suppliers the company supply chain policy and their expectations on responsible supply chains of covered minerals.

subCriterion.name: Contractual Requirements
subCriterion.description: Incorporate disclosure requirements and requirement to comply with company's supply chain policy into contracts and/or agreements with immediate suppliers.

subCriterion.name: Capability Building
subCriterion.description: Consider ways the company can support and build capabilities of immediate suppliers to improve performance and conform to company supply chain policy.

subCriterion.name: EITI Support
subCriterion.description: Support the implementation of the principles and criteria of the Extractive Industry Transparency Initiative (EITI) individually or through joint efforts.

subCriterion.name: Improvement Plans
subCriterion.description: Design measurable improvement plans with immediate suppliers, with involvement of relevant stakeholders when pursuing Step 3 risk mitigation.

subCriterion.name: Step 1E - Establish Company-Level Grievance Mechanism
subCriterion.description: Company must have a mechanism allowing internal and external parties to voice concerns regarding mineral extraction, trade and handling circumstances.

subCriterion.name: Grievance Mechanism Access
subCriterion.description: Have a mechanism allowing any internal or external interested party, including affected parties and whistle-blowers, to voice concerns regarding mineral extraction, trade and handling circumstances.

subCriterion.name: Grievance Records
subCriterion.description: Record concerns received through the company mechanism and the results of follow-up.

conformityCriterion.name: Step 2 - Identify and Assess Risks in Upstream Supply Chain
conformityCriterion.description: Companies must identify the scope of risk assessment, map factual circumstances of supply chains, and assess risks against Annex II criteria.

subCriterion.name: Step 2A - Red Flag Review
subCriterion.description: Company must review relevant information to conduct red flag review of locations of covered minerals origin and transit, and supplier red-flags.

subCriterion.name: Information Review Process
subCriterion.description: Have and implement a process to review information gathered in Step 1 to determine whether there are any discrepancies or inconsistencies.

subCriterion.name: Due Diligence Trigger Assessment
subCriterion.description: Have and implement a process to review information gathered in Step 1 to determine whether further steps of due diligence are triggered.

subCriterion.name: Information Validation Process
subCriterion.description: Design and implement a process to validate information on covered minerals and materials received.

subCriterion.name: Material Consistency Verification
subCriterion.description: Confirm that the type, weight, composition and quality of covered minerals and materials received are consistent with accompanying documentation.

subCriterion.name: Information Collection Confirmation
subCriterion.description: Confirm that information required for red flag review has been collected and/or provided by immediate suppliers and known upstream actors.

subCriterion.name: Discrepancy Investigation
subCriterion.description: Investigate and address any discrepancies or inconsistencies identified during the validation review.

subCriterion.name: Supply Plausibility Assessment
subCriterion.description: Design and implement a process to understand plausibility of covered mineral supply.

subCriterion.name: Production Statistics Understanding
subCriterion.description: Maintain a reasonable understanding of reserves, production and export statistics and trends for all mining countries and/or regional mining areas.

subCriterion.name: Mining Site Information
subCriterion.description: Consider available information on mining sites such as geological studies, on-site visits or other data where the company has direct relationship with a mine.

subCriterion.name: Secondary Materials Assessment
subCriterion.description: Consider the type, volume and chemical content received for secondary materials.

subCriterion.name: Volume Anomaly Investigation
subCriterion.description: Investigate and address any higher-than-expected volumes of covered mineral supplied from any area compared to potential for production in that area.

subCriterion.name: CAHRA Determination Process
subCriterion.description: Design and implement a process to determine any Conflict-Affected and High-Risk Areas (CAHRAs).

subCriterion.name: Minimum CAHRA List
subCriterion.description: Include at minimum: DRC and nine adjoining countries as outlined in Dodd Frank Act, and indicative list of CAHRAs provided by European Commission pursuant to EU Regulation 2017/821.

subCriterion.name: CAHRA Identification Resources
subCriterion.description: Document the types of resources used by the company to identify CAHRAs.

subCriterion.name: CAHRA Criteria
subCriterion.description: Document the criteria used by the company to determine a CAHRA.

subCriterion.name: CAHRA Review Frequency
subCriterion.description: Document the frequency within which the CAHRA determination is reviewed and updated.

subCriterion.name: CAHRA Supply Chain Record
subCriterion.description: Maintain a record of all countries and/or areas identified as Conflict-Affected or High-Risk within the company's supply chain.

subCriterion.name: Sanctions List Consultation
subCriterion.description: Include in the process a general consultation of relevant national and international sanctions lists.

conformityCriterion.name: Step 3 - Design and Implement Risk Management Strategy
conformityCriterion.description: Companies must report findings to senior management, devise and adopt risk management plans, implement and monitor risk mitigation efforts.

subCriterion.name: Step 3A - Report Findings to Senior Management
subCriterion.description: Company must ensure all risks identified during Step 2 are reported to senior manager with designated responsibility for due diligence.

subCriterion.name: Step 3B - Devise and Adopt Risk Management Plan
subCriterion.description: Company must develop plan to manage identified risks taking into account options of continuing trade, suspending trade while managing risks, or disengaging.

subCriterion.name: Risk Management Strategy Options
subCriterion.description: Have process to continue trade throughout measurable risk mitigation efforts; OR temporarily suspend trade while pursuing ongoing measurable mitigation efforts; AND/OR disengage with supplier where mitigation is not feasible.

subCriterion.name: Risk Policy Review
subCriterion.description: Review identified risks against company policy to determine relevant risk management strategy and risk management plan.

subCriterion.name: Progressive Improvement Plan
subCriterion.description: When mitigating risks, include in risk management plan description of means to achieve progressive improvement within reasonable timescales.

subCriterion.name: Leverage Building
subCriterion.description: To support progressive improvement, build and/or exercise leverage over actors in supply chain who can most effectively and directly mitigate risks.

subCriterion.name: Stakeholder Consultation
subCriterion.description: Consult with suppliers and affected stakeholders to agree on strategy for risk mitigation including qualitative or quantitative measures of improvement.

subCriterion.name: Risk Assessment Publication
subCriterion.description: Publish supply chain risk assessment and risk management plan with due regard to business confidentiality and competitive concerns.

subCriterion.name: Sanctions Response
subCriterion.description: Include in risk management strategy and plan responses to risks associated with relevant national and international sanctions.

subCriterion.name: Step 3C - Implement Risk Management Plan
subCriterion.description: Company must ensure risk mitigation plan is implemented and progressive success monitored in cooperation with relevant stakeholders.

subCriterion.name: Plan Implementation
subCriterion.description: Have and implement the risk management plan.

subCriterion.name: Performance Monitoring
subCriterion.description: Monitor and track performance of risk mitigation in cooperation with stakeholders.

subCriterion.name: Senior Management Reporting
subCriterion.description: Report back to designated senior management and consider suspending or discontinuing engagement with supplier after failed attempts at mitigation.

subCriterion.name: Community Monitoring Network
subCriterion.description: Consider establishing or supporting a community monitoring network to monitor or track performance of risk mitigation.

subCriterion.name: Sanctions Implementation
subCriterion.description: Implement risk management strategy and plan for risks associated with relevant national and international sanctions.

subCriterion.name: Step 3D - Additional Fact and Risk Assessments
subCriterion.description: Company must conduct ongoing monitoring and repeat information gathering and cross-checking after implementation of risk management plan or following changes in supply chain.

conformityCriterion.name: Step 4 - Carry Out Independent Third-Party Audit
conformityCriterion.description: Companies must undergo independent third-party audits following ISO 19011:2018 standard, allowing auditor access to sites, personnel, and documentation.

subCriterion.name: Third-Party Audit Access
subCriterion.description: Company must allow independent third-party audit of activities, processes and supply chain due diligence, ensuring adequate preparation with documentation and allowing auditor access to sites, personnel and records.

subCriterion.name: ISO 19011:2018 Compliance
subCriterion.description: Assessment must follow ISO 19011:2018 auditing standard providing guidance on auditing management systems, audit program management, and auditor competence evaluation.

subCriterion.name: Combined Standards Assessment
subCriterion.description: Audit may combine environmental, occupational health and safety, social and governance standards with supply chain due diligence standards, with separate reports for each standard.

conformityCriterion.name: Step 5 - Report Annually on Supply Chain Due Diligence
conformityCriterion.description: Companies must annually report on due diligence for responsible supply chains, describing management systems, risk assessment methodology, and risk management strategies while protecting business confidentiality.

subCriterion.name: Annual Due Diligence Report
subCriterion.description: Companies must annually report on due diligence or integrate information into annual sustainability or corporate responsibility reports.

subCriterion.name: Management Systems Reporting
subCriterion.description: Report on company management systems including supply chain policy availability, management structure, information gathering system, record-keeping system, and disclosure methods.

subCriterion.name: Policy Publication
subCriterion.description: Report availability of company's supply chain policy with indication of RMAP audit completion and link to supply chain statement.

subCriterion.name: Information System Description
subCriterion.description: Describe the system used by company to gather information necessary for red-flag review.

subCriterion.name: Due Diligence Strengthening
subCriterion.description: Explain how information obtained for red flag review has strengthened the company's due diligence efforts.

subCriterion.name: Record-Keeping System
subCriterion.description: Describe the company's record-keeping system.

subCriterion.name: Disclosure Methods
subCriterion.description: Describe methods for disclosing relevant information to downstream actors.

subCriterion.name: Audit Summary Publication
subCriterion.description: Company must publish summary audit report with due regard to business confidentiality, including company details, audit date and period, audit activities and methodology, and audit conclusions.

subCriterion.name: Business Confidentiality Protection
subCriterion.description: All public information must take into account business confidentiality and competitive concerns including price information, supplier relationships, contract terms, tonnage and capacity.

conformityCriterion.name: Annex II Risk Management Requirements
conformityCriterion.description: Companies must address serious abuses associated with mineral extraction, support to armed groups and security forces, bribery, money laundering, and non-payment of taxes.

subCriterion.name: Serious Abuses Prevention
subCriterion.description: Companies must not tolerate any forms of torture, cruel, inhuman and degrading treatment; forced or compulsory labor; worst forms of child labor; gross human rights violations; war crimes or serious violations of international humanitarian law.

subCriterion.name: Torture and Cruel Treatment Prevention
subCriterion.description: Prevent any forms of torture, cruel, inhuman and degrading treatment in mineral extraction, transport or trade.

subCriterion.name: Forced Labor Prevention
subCriterion.description: Prevent any forms of forced or compulsory labor in mineral supply chains.

subCriterion.name: Child Labor Prevention
subCriterion.description: Prevent the worst forms of child labor as defined in ILO Convention No. 182.

subCriterion.name: Human Rights Violations Prevention
subCriterion.description: Prevent other gross human rights violations and abuses such as widespread sexual violence.

subCriterion.name: War Crimes Prevention
subCriterion.description: Prevent war crimes or other serious violations of international humanitarian law, crimes against humanity or genocide.

subCriterion.name: Non-State Armed Groups
subCriterion.description: Companies must not provide direct or indirect support to non-state armed groups who illegally control, tax or extort benefits at mines, trading points, transportation routes or supply chain actors.

subCriterion.name: Direct Support Prevention
subCriterion.description: Prevent direct financial or logistical support to non-state armed groups.

subCriterion.name: Indirect Support Prevention
subCriterion.description: Prevent indirect support through payments, taxes or extortion that benefit non-state armed groups.

subCriterion.name: Security Forces Support
subCriterion.description: Companies must avoid providing direct or indirect support to public or private security forces that commit human rights abuses.

subCriterion.name: Bribery and Fraudulent Misrepresentation
subCriterion.description: Companies must prevent bribery and fraudulent misrepresentation of the origin of minerals.

subCriterion.name: Bribery Prevention
subCriterion.description: Prevent bribery and corruption in mineral supply chains.

subCriterion.name: Fraudulent Misrepresentation Prevention
subCriterion.description: Prevent fraudulent misrepresentation of the origin of minerals.

subCriterion.name: Money Laundering Prevention
subCriterion.description: Companies must prevent money laundering in mineral supply chains.

subCriterion.name: Tax, Fees and Royalties Payment
subCriterion.description: Companies must ensure payment of taxes, fees and royalties to governments in accordance with EITI principles.

subCriterion.name: Tax Compliance
subCriterion.description: Ensure proper payment of taxes to relevant government authorities.

subCriterion.name: Fees and Royalties Payment
subCriterion.description: Ensure proper payment of fees and royalties to government authorities.

subCriterion.name: EITI Principles Compliance
subCriterion.description: Align payment practices with Extractive Industry Transparency Initiative principles.

conformityCriterion.name: CAHRA-Specific Due Diligence Requirements
conformityCriterion.description: Additional requirements for materials known or suspected to be from Conflict-Affected and High-Risk Areas, including enhanced chain of custody, on-the-ground assessments, and Annex II risk assessment.

subCriterion.name: CAHRA Chain of Custody System
subCriterion.description: Establish chain of custody or traceability system that generates detailed information on circumstances of extraction, export, processing or trade for CAHRA materials.

subCriterion.name: Data Request Rights
subCriterion.description: Seek to incorporate right for company to request data required to complete risk assessment into written agreements with immediate suppliers.

subCriterion.name: Detailed CAHRA Information Collection
subCriterion.description: Collect detailed information including material description, ownership and corporate structure, transportation routes, and export/import documentation.

subCriterion.name: CAHRA Payment Records
subCriterion.description: If supplier not RMAP assessed, collect records of all taxes, fees, royalties and other payments made to government officials and security forces throughout supply chain.

subCriterion.name: CAHRA Mine Origin Information
subCriterion.description: Collect information on mine of origin, quantity and dates of extraction, method of extraction (ASM or LSM), and locations of consolidation, trade or processing.

subCriterion.name: CAHRA Upstream Actors Identification
subCriterion.description: Identify all upstream intermediaries, consolidators or other actors in the upstream supply chain for CAHRA materials.

subCriterion.name: On-the-Ground Assessment Requirements
subCriterion.description: Conduct on-the-ground assessments or engage aligned upstream assurance mechanism to understand local context, work with stakeholders, and monitor risk management.

subCriterion.name: Assessment Team Independence
subCriterion.description: On-the-ground assessment team must be independent of activities being assessed and understand local context.

subCriterion.name: Local Stakeholder Engagement
subCriterion.description: Assessment team must work with local stakeholders to understand context and address concerns.

subCriterion.name: Risk Management Monitoring
subCriterion.description: Assessment team must suggest and monitor risk management activities and address grievances.

subCriterion.name: Annex II Risk Assessment Process
subCriterion.description: Cross-check factual information against company supply chain policy and standards to carry out comprehensive risk assessment for CAHRA materials.

subCriterion.name: Supply Chain Policy Comparison
subCriterion.description: Compare available information against company supply chain policy principles and standards referencing Annex II.

subCriterion.name: National Laws Comparison
subCriterion.description: Compare information against national laws of countries where company is domiciled, where minerals originate, and of transport or re-export.

subCriterion.name: Legal Instruments Comparison
subCriterion.description: Compare against legal instruments governing company operations such as financing agreements, contractor agreements and supplier agreements.

subCriterion.name: International Instruments Comparison
subCriterion.description: Compare against relevant international instruments such as OECD Guidelines for Multinational Enterprises, international human rights and humanitarian law, and sanctions lists.

conformityCriterion.name: Precious Group Metals Additional Requirements
conformityCriterion.description: Additional requirements for companies sourcing or processing precious group metals (gold, silver, platinum, palladium) including enhanced security measures and ASM engagement.

subCriterion.name: Unique Reference Assignment
subCriterion.description: Assign unique reference number to each input and output for precious group metals processing.

subCriterion.name: Physical Security Measures
subCriterion.description: Adopt tamper proof physical security measures including security of transport, sealing, and tamper-proof containers.

subCriterion.name: Shipment Inspection Requirements
subCriterion.description: Inspect all shipments for completeness of documentation, verify weight and quality information, and verify physical security practices of immediate supplier.

subCriterion.name: Output Identification Requirements
subCriterion.description: Record and render all material outputs identifiable with refiner name/stamp/logo, year of refining/production, and unique reference for each output.

subCriterion.name: ASM Direct Engagement
subCriterion.description: Seek to engage directly with legitimate ASM producers or their representatives where possible for precious group metals sourcing.

subCriterion.name: Law Enforcement Cooperation
subCriterion.description: Fully and transparently cooperate with law enforcement agencies regarding covered mineral transactions and provide customs officials with access to complete information on international shipments.

conformityCriterion.name: Secondary Materials Requirements
conformityCriterion.description: Specific requirements for sourcing and processing secondary materials (recycled materials) including verification of recycled content and enhanced due diligence for high-value transactions.

subCriterion.name: Secondary Material Documentation
subCriterion.description: Obtain and retain information to demonstrate receipts are secondary and out-of-scope for CAHRA assessment including material description, supplier information, and transport documentation.

subCriterion.name: Precious Metals Secondary Verification
subCriterion.description: For precious group metals secondary materials, obtain sufficient information to reasonably exclude false representations made to hide origin of newly mined materials in recycled supply chains.

subCriterion.name: High-Value Transaction Due Diligence
subCriterion.description: For materials sourced from location outside CAHRA, carry out additional due diligence for transactions beyond threshold of $15,000 USD cash per transaction, proportional to transaction value.

regulatoryAlignment.name: OECD Due Diligence Guidance for Responsible Supply Chains of Minerals from Conflict-Affected and High-Risk Areas

administeredBy.name: Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD)

regulatoryAlignment.name: Section 1502 of the US Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act

geographicScope.name: World
geographicScope.schemeName: UN M49 Standard Country or Area Codes

performanceLevelCode.name: Conformant
performanceLevelCode.description: Full conformance with all applicable OECD due diligence requirements and RMI standard criteria.

performanceLevelCode.name: Conditionally Conformant
performanceLevelCode.description: Substantial conformance with minor non-conformances that can be addressed within specified timeframes.

performanceLevelCode.name: Non-Conformant
performanceLevelCode.description: Significant non-conformances requiring corrective action before conformance can be achieved.

tagCode.name: OECD-Step1
tagCode.description: Criteria related to establishing strong company management systems.

tagCode.name: OECD-Step2
tagCode.description: Criteria related to identifying and assessing risks in upstream supply chains.

tagCode.name: OECD-Step3
tagCode.description: Criteria related to designing and implementing risk management strategies.

tagCode.name: OECD-Step4
tagCode.description: Criteria related to independent third-party audits.

tagCode.name: OECD-Step5
tagCode.description: Criteria related to annual public reporting on due diligence.

tagCode.name: CAHRA
tagCode.description: Criteria specifically applicable to Conflict-Affected and High-Risk Areas.

tagCode.name: PreciousMetals
tagCode.description: Criteria with additional requirements for precious group metals (gold, silver, platinum, palladium).

tagCode.name: SecondaryMaterials
tagCode.description: Criteria applicable to recycled and secondary materials.

tagCode.name: SupplyChain
tagCode.description: Criteria targeting supply chain management and transparency.

tagCode.name: RiskManagement
tagCode.description: Criteria focused on risk assessment and mitigation strategies.

tagCode.name: HumanRights
tagCode.description: Criteria addressing human rights protection and abuse prevention.

tagCode.name: AntiCorruption
tagCode.description: Criteria focused on preventing bribery, corruption, and financial crimes.

tagCode.name: Transparency
tagCode.description: Criteria emphasizing transparency and public reporting requirements.

tagCode.name: ASM
tagCode.description: Criteria specific to Artisanal and Small-Scale Mining operations.

tagCode.name: OnGroundAssessment
tagCode.description: Criteria requiring physical assessment and local stakeholder engagement.
